result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Conc. (.17-.199)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Conc. (.17-.199)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Conc. (.17-.199)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Conc. (.17-.199)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Valerie A. Scheel was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Conc. (.17-.199)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit as listed below.  Sentence shall run consecutive to any other imposed sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit a payment with amount deemed appropriate by the agent on a monthly basis.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  No intoxicants.  No firearms or ammunition.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Defendant shall Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  Defendant shall Submit to Random Urinalysis.    Submit DNA sample.  Defendant shall comply with Thinking for Change Program.
Restitution to be determined by the District Attorney within 30 days or deemed waived, any objections to be filed within 10 days of notice of determination.

supervisions.notes: IID requirement applies to all vehicles which are registered in your name and any vehicles you operate.  During your IID requirement period, you may not operate any motor vehicle without an IID installed.
